div.bibl: The Sentinel, Wk. of November 23, 1923. Vols. 51-52, p.16.

body.p: A gift of $2,500 a year to create a research fellowship in connection with the Institute of Meat Packing at the University of Chicago has been made by Arthur Lowenstein. He is chairman of the committee on Scientific Research of the Institute of American Meat Packers, and vice-president of Wilson and Co. Results of this research will be made available to the entire meat packing industry.
